001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.zeromq;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
004import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinClient;
005import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.internal.BitcoinClientThreadFactory;
006import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Flowable;
007import org.bitcoinj.core.Context;
008import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainBinaryService;
009import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.jsonrpc.RxBitcoinClient;
010import org.reactivestreams.Publisher;
011
012import java.io.Closeable;
013import java.net.URI;
014import java.util.Optional;
015
016import static org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.zeromq.BitcoinZmqMessage.Topic.*;
017
018/**
019 * Service to listen for ZMQ messages from multiple TCP ports. Uses Bitcoin Core JSON-RPC to find
020 * the TCP address of the required services.
021 * TODO: Support using all topics, notjust `rawblock` and `rawtx`.
022 */
023public class RxBitcoinZmqBinaryService implements RxBlockchainBinaryService, Closeable {
024    protected final BitcoinClient client;
025    private final RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService blockService;
026    private final RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService txService;
027
028    private final Flowable<byte[]> flowableRawTx;
029    private final Flowable<byte[]> flowableRawBlock;
030
031    private final BitcoinClientThreadFactory threadFactory;
032
033    public RxBitcoinZmqBinaryService(Network network, URI rpcUri, String rpcUser, String rpcPassword) {
034        this(new RxBitcoinClient(network, rpcUri, rpcUser, rpcPassword));
035    }
036
037    public RxBitcoinZmqBinaryService(BitcoinClient client) {
038        this.client = client;
039        threadFactory = new BitcoinClientThreadFactory(Context.getOrCreate(), "RxBitcoinZmq Thread");
040
041        // TODO: Create background thread to look for the ZMQ Ports
042        BitcoinZmqPortFinder portFinder = new BitcoinZmqPortFinder(client);
043
044        Optional<URI> blockServiceURI = portFinder.findPort(rawblock);
045        Optional<URI> txServiceURI = portFinder.findPort(rawtx);
046
047        if (!(blockServiceURI.isPresent() && txServiceURI.isPresent())) {
048            throw new RuntimeException("Bitcoin Core configuration error");
049        }
050
051        if (blockServiceURI.get().equals(txServiceURI.get())) {
052            // URIs are the same we can use a single connection
053            blockService = new RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService(blockServiceURI.get(), threadFactory, rawblock, rawtx);
054            txService = blockService;
055        } else {
056            blockService = new RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService(blockServiceURI.get(), threadFactory, rawblock);
057            txService = new RxBitcoinSinglePortZmqService(txServiceURI.get(), threadFactory, rawtx);
058        }
059
060        flowableRawBlock = Flowable.fromPublisher(blockService.blockBinaryPublisher());
061        flowableRawTx = Flowable.fromPublisher(txService.transactionBinaryPublisher());
062    }
063
064    @Override
065    public Publisher<byte[]> transactionBinaryPublisher() {
066        return flowableRawTx;
067    }
068
069    @Override
070    public Publisher<byte[]> transactionHashBinaryPublisher() {
071        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented");
072    }
073
074    @Override
075    public Publisher<byte[]> blockBinaryPublisher() {
076        return flowableRawBlock;
077    }
078
079    @Override
080    public Publisher<byte[]> blockHashBinaryPublisher() {
081        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented");
082    }
083
084    @Override
085    public void close()  {
086        blockService.close();
087        txService.close();
088        try {
089            client.close();
090        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
091            throw new RuntimeException(e);
092        }
093    }
094}
